page.title: 04PEEL HALL FARM
page.content: Peel Hall has an interesting past, was one of the peels used for purposes of habitation and defence. Peel means farmhouse fortified by moat or palisade. Farm has a moat round the house used for defence, When invaders were near owners would take the animals into the large dry stone cellars of the building until danger had passed. Present owner, many years ago, drained the moat and rebuilt the walls in sandstone. Depth varies from 6-9 feet is 20 feet wide and 0.25 acre in area. House and moat are fed by spring water. Farm has been in family since 1897. Present owner has farmed here for past 25 years. This farm is 210 acres, has 175 cows looked after by 3 people. Cows are bred for sale and milk production. Today the milk yields and feeding are recorded by computer.
